About.subtitle: Kryfal

brand_protection.title: Corporate Counterintelligence
brand_protection.description: Protect your business from the inside out with investigative intelligence for maximum confidence decisions.
brand_protection.list_title_Description_desafio: The integrity of your operation directly depends on the robustness of your supply chain — which includes both external suppliers and internal human capital. The failure to rigorously verify a single link, whether a critical logistics partner or a newly hired executive, can introduce vulnerabilities across your entire structure. Superficial credential analysis and purely financial auditing are insufficient to detect the most damaging risks: premeditated fraud, conflicts of interest, hidden legal, and reputational liabilities. Hiring or partnering without a prior Background Check analysis is managing the business based on an incomplete and dangerous view of the operational and ethical reality of your partners.
brand_protection.list_title_solucao: Decisions Based on Facts, Not Assumptions
brand_protection.list_title_Description_solucao: Our Corporate Intelligence and Investigations service is your diligence and verification unit. We act discreetly and methodically to verify facts, analyze histories, and expose hidden risks before they become a problem. Combining advanced techniques of open-source investigation (OSINT), data analysis, and, when necessary, field verification, we provide a complete dossier to ensure that your hiring, partnership, and investment decisions are based on verified information.

SectionServiceSecond.title: Intelligence at All Levels
SectionServiceSecond.description: From strategy to action, we provide actionable intelligence at all levels of your organization.

card1.title: Strategic Intelligence (For Leadership)
card1.description: We deliver executive reports that connect the threat landscape (actors, trends, geopolitical risks) directly to your business objectives and continuity. Our analyses answer the (why) and (what if), recommending strategic and investment directions.

card2.title: Tactical Intelligence (For Active Defense)
card2.description: We produce detailed dossiers on the Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs) of attack groups targeting your sector. We describe their methods and tools to enrich your threat hunting, enhance your detection rules, and train your defense team.

card3.title: Operational Intelligence (For the SOC)

card4.title: Vulnerability Intelligence (For IT and Infrastructure)
card4.description: We monitor and analyze vulnerabilities (CVEs) that are relevant to your technological stack and are actively being discussed or exploited by cybercriminals. This allows for patching prioritization based on real risk, not just theoretical criticality.

vip_protection.title: Deep & Dark Web Surveillance and Asset Protection
vip_protection.description: A unified service to monitor both the threat actor and your exposed digital assets.
vip_protection.list_title_Description_desafio: Your company faces two critical and invisible risks: the adversary planning an attack and your own sensitive data that may already be compromised. How do you monitor both sides of this equation – the hunter and the prey – in an anonymous and hostile environment like the Deep & Dark Web? Hiring separate solutions creates complexity and disconnects intelligence from action.
vip_protection.list_title_solucao: Monitoring and Protection of Critical Data
vip_protection.list_title_Description_solucao: Our Surveillance and Asset Protection service offers a complete view of your risk in the digital underworld. We unify Threat Intelligence (monitoring the attacker) with Exposed Asset Detection (searching for your data) in a single offering. Through a centralized platform and the expertise of our analysts, we correlate criminals' intentions with the actual exposure of your data, enabling a truly proactive defense and a much more effective incident response.

OPSEC.title: OPSEC – Strategies for Anonymous Operations
OPSEC.description: In a scenario where every click leaves a trail and exposure.

modal.description: In a scenario where every click leaves a trail and exposure can compromise an entire operation, mastering OPSEC means having full control over your digital footprint, identity, and operational security.
modal.second_description: This course doesn't just present concepts — it delivers practical strategies, tested methods, and real techniques that we at Kryfal's team apply daily for in-field protection.
modal.list_title: By the end of the course, you will be able to:
listItems: Create secure digital environments for investigations and operations;
Apply anonymity techniques to avoid tracking and exposure;
Reduce the personal and operational attack surface;
Implement security routines that protect both the operator and the mission;
Operate with confidence and discretion in hostile environments — whether physical or digital.

Threat_Intelligence.title: Fundamentals in Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI)
Threat_Intelligence.description: In an increasingly dynamic and complex digital scenario.

modal.description: In an increasingly dynamic and complex digital scenario, understanding the fundamentals of Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) has become essential for any security professional or related area.
modal.second_description: This training was developed to clearly and structurally present the concepts, methodologies, and frameworks that form the basis of threat intelligence. Throughout the course, participants will learn to differentiate data from intelligence, understand the intelligence cycle, learn analytical models widely used in the market, and visualize how CTI supports strategic and operational decisions. The goal is to provide a solid foundation so that each participant can safely advance to more technical and analytical levels in the future.
modal.list_title: By the end of the course, you will be able to:
listItems: Understand the Intelligence Cycle and its application in the context of cyber threats;
Recognize and classify different types of open sources (OSINT) for basic information collection;
Understand the fundamental concepts of threat modeling and how to adapt them to different organizational contexts;
Differentiate the levels of intelligence (Tactical, Operational, and Strategic) and understand how each supports decision-making;
Have an introductory view of the MITRE ATT&CK Framework and its use in identifying adversary tactics and techniques.

Pentest_Web.title: Web Pentest
Pentest_Web.description: In a scenario where every click leaves a trail and exposure.

modal.description: In a scenario where the security of web applications is constantly challenged by sophisticated threats and vulnerabilities can cost millions, mastering Web Pentest means not only identifying flaws but anticipating and neutralizing attacks before they happen.
modal.second_description: This training is not limited to presenting tools or a checklist; it delivers attack and defense strategies, tested methodologies, and real techniques to protect critical infrastructures day-to-day.
modal.list_title: By the end of the course, you will be able to:
listItems: Recognize and diagnose vulnerabilities such as injection (SQL, NoSQL), misconfigured access control, sensitive data exposure, encryption failures, incorrect security configuration, API issues, and authentication bypass;
Utilize methodologies for information gathering, exploitation, risk analysis, and pentest report production, simulating real attacks to identify flaws in web applications;
Employ specialized tools, such as Kali Linux and OWASP ZAP, to evaluate and test web applications in the most common OWASP Top 10 scenarios;
